Name: Fragment of a frieze
Description: At the beginning of the Coptic Period, architectural elements were often decorated with friezes containing naturalistic motifs. Composed of vines, acanthus and palms, the scenes also show animal representations. This fragment, which dates to the 5th century, bears two vines, tied together, on which rests a bird which seems to peck at one of the leaves. The lower band is decorated with a braid of pearls and pirouettes.
